question: Match the following:
column_I: World Health Organisation (WHO) definition of reproductive health
Physically and functionally normal reproductive organs
Normal emotional and behavioural interactions among people in all sex-related aspects
column_II: A society might be called reproductively healthy
A total well-being in all aspects of reproduction, i.e., physical, emotional, behavioural and social
Healthy reproductive organs with normal functions
Includes emotional and social aspects of reproduction
matches: Reproductive health–A society might be called reproductively healthy
World Health Organisation (WHO) definition of reproductive health–A total well-being in all aspects of reproduction, i.e., physical, emotional, behavioural and social
Physically and functionally normal reproductive organs–Healthy reproductive organs with normal functions
Normal emotional and behavioural interactions among people in all sex-related aspects–Includes emotional and social aspects of reproduction
answer: Reproductive health–A society might be called reproductively healthy, World Health Organisation (WHO) definition of reproductive health–A total well-being in all aspects of reproduction, i.e., physical, emotional, behavioural and social, Physically and functionally normal reproductive organs–Healthy reproductive organs with normal functions, Normal emotional and behavioural interactions among people in all sex-related aspects–Includes emotional and social aspects of reproduction
